page.title: 14Farming.
page.content: Sywell is predominately a farming area although it accounts for very few jobs. There are six farms in our block. Most farmers grow wheat, barley, rape, potatoes and hay, and keep cows and sheep. The crops are the most important. The farmers rotate their crops: first they grow potatoes, then wheat, then barley and lastly rape before going back to potatoes. Soft-fruit farms are also in the vicinity, though just outside our block, which specialise in "Pick your own". The farmers own their own machinery. They help each other at harvest time and when they set and spray the crops. Special people help at sheep shearing time. Casual labour is taken on to help at potato harvesting. There are no orchards.
